etymology.interpretation: Left component 足 ‘foot’ signals meaning related to movement and actions done with the feet, such as running. Right component 包 serves as the phonetic, guiding the pronunciation toward pǎo. Together they point to senses like running or fleeing.

examples.chinese: 我每天早上去公园跑步(我每天早上去公園跑步)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ měitiān zǎoshang qù gōngyuán pǎobù.
examples.english: I go running in the park every morning.

examples.chinese: 孩子害怕大狗(孩子害怕大狗)，转身就跑(轉身就跑)。
examples.pinyin: Háizi hàipà dà gǒu, zhuǎnshēn jiù pǎo.
examples.english: The child was afraid of the big dog and immediately ran away.

examples.chinese: 管道跑气了(管道跑氣了)，大家赶紧往外跑(大家趕緊往外跑)。
examples.pinyin: Guǎndào pǎo qì le, dàjiā gǎnjǐn wǎng wài pǎo.
examples.english: The pipe is leaking gas; everyone hurry and run outside.
